    What is 'The Story Hunt'?

    'The Story Hunt: Uncover the EU' is a programme hosted by Datenschule and OpenBudgets of Open Knowledge Foundation Germany. Together with journalists, domain-experts, developers and designers , we want to develop and practice the skills needed to hunt stories in financial data.

    The programme is split into two separate parts: a series of Trainings and a weekend-long Data Expedition in a forgotten castle outside of Berlin.

    The bootcamp is tailored to aspiring data journalists that are interested in improving their data skills. The trainings will culminate in the workshop at end of June, where - together with proven experts - we are going to dive into a massive database of the European Union’s primary financial instrument, the ESIFunds. During the expedition we will form interdisciplinary teams that collaboratively work on finding stories, leads, and doing analysis on data around the EU and its money flows. This will offer an ideal opportunity to practice the acquired skills in a supportive environment.

    Uncover the EU

    The EU and its money flows are notoriously complex and partially intransparent. Over the past year, the team behind SubsidyStories.eu has gathered, cleaned, and concatenated data on the EU’s most important financial instrument: the European Structural Investment Funds (ESIF). Together with representatives of different disciplines (journalists, developers, domain experts, and designers) we want to immerse ourselves in the this data, hunting for stories.

    That is why the Open Knowledge Foundation Germany has worked over the past year to open the data on EU subsidies with subsidystories.eu. This is only the beginning of our EU Transparency work and we invite the participants to work with this data together with us on analysing money flows and increasing EU Transparency.

    Together with the teams of Datenschule and OpenBudgets.eu, we will host a data expedition. On this three day workshop, the Bootcamp’s participants will work together with 25 experts from the field of journalism, programming, advocacy, and design to work on data, analysis and story-telling.

    Download the ESIF data quality report

    Trainings

    The Story Hunt Training sessions are the preparation series for participating in our weekend workshop. If you are based in Berlin and an early-career data journalists, EU policy analyst, or NGO or advocacy officer, we invite you to sign up for our 5 training sessions in May and June, where you learn the basics of data-gathering, cleaning and analysis in the realm of EU policy. We offer 5 weekly 2 hour training sessions teaching essential data skills: the basics of data-journalism, obtaining and cleaning data, as well as analysing and visualising it. The trainings will take place at the Open Knowledge Foundation Germany’s offices in Berlin.

    We offer 5 weekly 2 hour training sessions teaching essential data skills: the basics of data-journalism, obtaining and cleaning data, as well as analysing and visualising it. The trainings will take place at the Open Knowledge Foundation Germany’s offices in Berlin.

    The trainings offered cover the basic skills of finding, scraping, analysing, and visualising data. The Bootcamp will take place in the offices of OKF DE in Berlin.

    Join the bootcamp and become a full-fledged hunch-hunter!

    1. Getting Finished

    16 May 2017

    The first meeting will be an introduction in the coming weeks topics. We will present inspiring data journalism stories and give an introduction of large data projects at OKFDE such as subsidystories.eu and JedeSchule.de.

    Register Now!

    2. Finding and Getting the Data

    23 May 2017

    In this workshop we will start with the basics of data. We put questions to datasets and discuss effective ways to find data, how to get to know your data and spreadsheet tips and tricks.

    Register Now!

    3. Scraping Data

    30 May 2017

    In this workshop we explain the basics of scraping and show you meaningful ways and tools to obtain data from the web.

    Register Now!

    4. Cleaning Data

    6 June 2017

    In most cases, datasets are messy and need to be cleaned in some ways. Tools such as OpenRefine and Excel provide great ways to produce clean data.

    Register Now!

    5. Analytics: Basic Intro into Statistics & Spreadsheets

    13 June 2017

    Statistics have a bad reputation of being hard, and manipulative. In this workshop we will show why you should use statistics and how you can use basic statistics to validate your data, understand it and run basic functions for first analysis.

    Register Now!

    6. Visualising Data

    20 June 2017

    Data comes to life in visualisations. In this workshop we will discuss ground rules of design and data visualisations. We will work on telling a story with data.

    Register Now!

    Data Expedition

    The Story Hunt Data Expedition is a weekend-long workshop that will bring together the previously trained participants with experts from the field of programming, data analysis and design and take place in a forgotten castle outside of Berlin. A data expedition is a combination of group work, training, and mutual learning that teaches the whole investigative data pipeline process from asking questions to the dataset, hypothesising and analysing it and turning the results into stories, presentations and visualisations.

    It equips the participants with the skills they need to work on a data-driven story, and allows us to produce concrete results in one weekend.

    Forming mixed teams, the groups will go through the “data-pipeline” together starting by asking the question to presenting the data in the course of 3 days.

    Sign up!

    Traingings

    The training sessions are planned to accommodate up to 10 people. Our aim is to put together a group diverse in background but with a shared first experience in working with data.

    Requirement: Commitment for 5 weekly meetings, starting the 23 May 2017 and participation in the (free) Data Expedition 30 June - 2nd July. You should have affinity for data or interest in EU topics, plus a ton of Enthusiasm! :-)

    To apply, send us your CV as well as a short letter stating your motivation including a first idea of what you would like to investigate using the data on subsidystories.eu to anna.alberts@okfn.de and helene.hahn@okfn.de

    Applications run on a first come, first serve basis, so apply now!

    Data Expedition

    We have room for 25 experts in our data expedition weekend to Wartin Castle. We want to form a mixed group of Journalists, Programmers, Data Scientists, Domain Experts, Advocacy and NGO Officers, Designers etc. So if you recognize yourself as part of the following groups: Storyteller, Scout, Analyst, Engineer, or Designer, please apply and state your motivation and background in a short letter.

    Forming mixed teams, the groups will go through the “data-pipeline” together starting by asking the question to presenting the data in the course of 3 days.

    Together with the teams of Datenschule and OpenBudgets.eu, we will host a data expedition. On this three day workshops, you will work together with 25 experts from the field of journalism, programming, EU, advocacy, and design to work on data, analysis and story-telling.

    Agenda:

    Friday 30 June

    15:00 - 17:00 Travel Berlin - Wartin

    17:00 - 19:00 Introduction Lecture

    20:30 - 22:00 Forming Teams

    Saturday 1 July

    9:00 - 12:00 Formulating a question / Finding Data and Leads

    13:00 - 19:00 Cleaning and Analysing Data

    Sunday 2 July

    12:00 - 13:30 Story Telling and Visualisation Group Presentation and Wrap up

    13:30 - 16:00 Lunch and travel back to Berlin

    19:00 - Optional Presentation Berlin

    All costs for the weekend and travel within Europe (up to 250 E) are covered upon acceptance and participation in the expedition
